intro: Sayeria forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' sayeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America, specifically in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Sayeria forbesii is considered a rare and specialized flora.
